text: Hi, last week i used an webp image for a logo. It did not show up on Safari. Is there an workaround or should i refrain from using it, if Apple can´t be bothered to implement it in their OS´s?
Normally i use SVG but this logo available in SVG
on safari won’t work until apple will add the support
same for ie11
or firefox for android
<https://caniuse.com/#search=webp>
thanks, well the support is worse than i was aware off
Y’know if you just upload a png, HubSpot converts it to a webp for users whose browsers DO support it. saves you the time of implementing it and they handle the fallbacks. works great
Hi Jon, thats what i did...i just thought that webp would have already mor coverage / browser support, i was completely wrong about that..
Helo
yes, but you’ll probably want a more specific selector, as your current one will make ALL links in your email white

if you are looking to target <http://outlook.com|outlook.com> specifically, you can see here for doing this: <https://www.emailonacid.com/blog/article/email-development/how-to-create-excellent-emails-for-outlook-com/> Tip #7
>>>Outlook.com will prefix styles in their own special way. This means that you can include a style that will be ignored by all other email clients, but prefixed and parsed by <http://Outlook.com|Outlook.com>. See the example below:

`[owa] .foo { color:red; }`

Will become:

`.rps_a113 .x_foo { color:red; }`

<http://Outlook.com|Outlook.com> will recognize this code, but it will be ignored by other clients.
So i'm trying to get the hub-batch program (<https://github.com/williamspiro/hub-batch>) to work and keep encountering this issue when attempting to load it, anyone else get this? <@U6W3H6YN8>
Are you running `./app.js` or `node ./app.js` ? I remember running into that on windows when excluding the `node` keyword for scripts I intended on running via node
got it to run doing `node` kw in front but now I a getting additional errors:

May be a windows compatibility problem with this program, I’m not super familiar with it, but this is likely the problem <https://github.com/williamspiro/hub-batch/blob/master/js/modules/setuputils.js#L8>
re: <https://stackoverflow.com/questions/9080085/node-js-find-home-directory-in-platform-agnostic-way/32556337#32556337> , it may not be able to process the homeDirectory in the same way in all OS’s
well ill be dammed, that did it
<https://gph.is/2smtVVn>
You should post documentation to the repo or put up an issue if it requires a change to the code
i spoke to soon, it broke again on the next rerun lol
i plan on posting to it once i get it working

<@U7UBMQMDK> do you happen to have a copy of the contents of the `config.json` file from the `js/static` folder? It looks like it should be saving the config entered when going through the setup, but it just clears out the file instead
Thanks very much all for the help and the tips today - got it sorted and learned a ton.   I don't do much email template dev so delighted to get the tips here.  Thank you :slightly_smiling_face:

Thanks for the collaboration on this <@U7UBMQMDK> - and thanks for contributing documentation (once it's working) <@U2H3TT8F2> - HubBatch is a kickass tool, but still early, early days. We all need to collab to keep building it out :slightly_smiling_face:
im still getting issues with it on the creation of the configuration files but i at least got it to load to prompt me for it
I know awhile ago Will had helped me directly but those messages are long gone lol
I unfortunately do not <@U2H3TT8F2>, I’ve actually never used hub-batch (or if I have, it was some time ago), just the similar scripts to achieve similar ends.
Sorry, I have not used hub-batch in so long, so I am not positive what is wrong :crying_cat_face:

lol totally understandable, we have been trying to run it in a windows env and got a portion through fixin it but still running into issue. <@UBLH6MN2Z> has been doing it really. We are going to give it a go in a linux environment as it looks to be more created for that environment.
